translation: That happiness which at first, as well as in the end, deludes the self, and which arises from sleep, indolence, and heedlessness—that is declared to be Tamasic.
commentary: 18.39 that which? Forward at first? f and? in the contract in the seel? f and? Sukham pleasure? Mohanam delusive? Atmanaḥ of the self? arising from sleep? indolence and heedlessness? That that? Tamasam Tamasic? Udaharatam is declared.Commentary Anubandhe In the conseence after the termination. The pleasure that is bequeathed by evil habits like drinking liors and eating worthless things is delusive of the self. The man becomes oblivious of the path he ought to tread. Such pleasure is very much of the nature of darkness.
